method.name: Advanced Ant Miner

reference.ref: Rafael S. Parpinelli, Heitor S. Lopes and Alex A. Freitas. Data Mining With an Ant Colony Optimization Algorithm". IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation 6:4 (2002) 321-332.

R.S. Parpinelli, H.S. Lopes and A.A. Freitas. An Ant Colony Algorithm for Classification Rule Discovery. In: H.A. Abbass, R.A. Sarker, C.S. Newton. (Eds.) Data Mining: a Heuristic Approach, pp. 191-208. London: Idea Group Publishing, 2002

generalDescription.type: Classification model by Ant Colony Optimization
generalDescription.objective: To determine a set of rules that predicts correctly the value of the target attribute
generalDescription.howWork:
This algorithm is based in an ant colony system and it is an extension of the Ant Miner approach. The basic model works as follows: each ant starts with an empty rule and the decision of adding a new term depends on a heurstic function and a pheromone value. The heuristic funtion is the entropy measure for each attribute-value. There is also a prune step that removes one bye one a term of the rule while this process improves the quality of that rule. Once the antecedent of the rule is totally built, the system chooses the as consequent class the majority class of the covered examples. The algorithm then selects the best ant/rule of the current iteration and add it to the rule-set. This process iterates until all examples are covered (depending on the paremeters of the user).
The differences of this approach with its antecesor are the following ones: * Selection of the output class of the rule before its contruction * New heuristic function which is class-dependent. * New rule quality measure * New pheromone update method * This approach works with ordered discretized attributes.

parameterSpec.param: Number_of_Ants: Total number of ants in the system
Max_number_of_uncovered_samples: Number of instances than can remain uncovered
Min_number_of_samples_by_rule: Minimum number of instances that a rule should cover
Max_Iterations_without_converge: Maximum number of iterations without getting any better solution in order to stop the search
Max_Pheromona: Maximum value for the pheromone function
Min_Pheromona: Minimum value for the pheromone function
Alpha: parameter for the pheromone function
Beta: parameter for the pheromone function

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Advanced_Ant_Miner Dataset: wisconsin Training set: wisconsin.dat Test set: wisconsin.dat Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check Parameters: default values
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment\results\Vis-Clas-Check folder the classification results for the test and train set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9458272327964861 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.05417276720351391 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.9458272327964861 Global N/C: 0.0
TRAIN RESULTS ============ Classifier= Summary of data, Classifiers: Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9458272327964861 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.05417276720351391 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.9458272327964861 Global N/C: 0.0
